instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR: What is PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR? PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR is PPBUS_G3H after it has passed through a backlight fuse and a transistor that allows power through when BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN are present. .
definitions.PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW: What is PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW? PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW is a line after the inductor in the DC to DC boost circuit for backlight that connects to the LED driver’s switch(SW) pin where it is switched to ground rapidly in order to create the boosted voltage for the backlight circuit. .
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.I2C_BKLT_SDA: What is I2C_BKLT_SDA? I2C_BKLT_SDA is a data line between the LCD screen and the LED driver. This data line cannot short to ground. If it does, the screen cannot talk to the LED driver, and the LED driver will not allow the circuit to produce a backlight..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Image but no backlight
threads.message:
Iv got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A in for repair, it has image but no backlight. Have tried another screen but still nothing. Its a difficult one as no boardview for it, so a nightmare to try and work out what is what. I have made the following diode readings, but don't have another board to compare it to so not overly sure what is correct and what isnt. I can see there are a couple of OL's in there. Im not sure if they should be or not, as the boardview that is marked as the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesnt actually resemble the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .

v noticed pin 3 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> is OL, its <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> . I have tried it pos to ground and neg to ground in diode mode, and both show OL. Not sure if this is correct or not ?

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> at the connector is 0.00 at the fuse its 12.55

If I check continuity between the connector pin and the diode / caps its showing as 000.3 so it appears to be connected ok to the connector.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> @ <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> @ <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> = 12.44v
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> @ connector = 0.00v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> = 0.15v
 <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> = 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Image but no backlight
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>?
Always check with red probe at ground.

Be sure <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> is not shorted A-K.
Post voltage for <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, pins 5, 18, 11, 17, 15, 16.
Check all the traces to J8300.

Did you test with correct screen for this model?
Try PRAM reset few times...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Image but no backlight
threads.message:
Diode mode at the connector shows OL with red to ground and also black to ground in diode mode. if I go from the connector pin back to the output caps it shows as 0.00 so has continuity.
<DIODE>D7701</DIODE> shows 0.317 one way, OL the other way.
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> - 
5 = 5.03v
18 = 5.03v
11 = 12.36v
17 = 3.306v
15 = 5.02v
16 = 5.02
il check the traces in a second. Iv tried smc and pram reset, wont work with any screens iv tried, just image and no bl.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Image but no backlight
threads.message:
Try another <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
Compare diode mode to ground on pins 15/16.
Check all resistors around it and also traces and solders.

Do you get image for sure, only missing backlight?
If possible, check with o-scope <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM_R</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SDA</SIGNAL>/SCL.
Should catch some activity pressing backlight adjust keys...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Image but no backlight
threads.message: You must use a 2015 15" display otherwise you are wasting time.
